intro: Paraphlomis albida, commonly known as the white false bugloss, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, square stems and small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Paraphlomis albida is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
